projects.title: PTO Manager
projects.shortDescription: Employee leave management system for vacation and personal day requests
projects.fullDescription: PTO Manager is a full-stack web application that streamlines the employee leave request process. Employees can submit vacation requests, personal days, and sick leave through an intuitive dashboard, while managers get a centralized panel to approve or reject requests with real-time team availability calendar. Built to eliminate the friction of email-based PTO workflows and reduce scheduling conflicts across teams.

process.title: Problem Definition
process.description: Identified the inefficiency of managing leave requests via email threads. Mapped out the core actors: employees, managers, and HR admins. Defined the minimum viable flow: request → notify → approve/reject → update balance.

process.title: Data Modeling & Architecture
process.description: Designed the database schema covering users, roles, leave types, leave balances, and request statuses. Defined REST API endpoints for each domain and established role-based access control between employee and manager views.

process.title: UI Design
process.description: Designed wireframes for the employee dashboard (balance summary, request form, history) and the manager panel (team calendar, pending requests queue). Prioritized clarity over complexity for day-to-day usability.

process.title: Development
process.description: Built the React frontend with context-based auth state and protected routes by role. Implemented the Node.js/Express API with JWT authentication, leave balance calculation logic, and conflict detection when multiple team members request the same dates.

projects.title: Study Buddy
projects.shortDescription: AI-powered flashcard generator for focused topic-based learning
projects.fullDescription: Study Buddy is a learning tool that lets users input any subject or topic and automatically generates a set of flashcards for active recall practice. Users can create custom decks, flip through cards in study mode, mark cards as mastered or needs review, and track their progress per topic. Designed for students and self-learners who want a faster way to go from raw material to structured review sessions without manually writing every card.

process.title: Concept & Scope
process.description: Started from the frustration of spending more time creating study material than actually studying. Defined the core loop: enter a topic → generate flashcards via AI → study with flip interaction → track which cards still need work. Scoped the MVP to a single-user experience without authentication complexity.

process.title: AI Prompt Engineering
process.description: Tested multiple prompt strategies against the OpenAI API to reliably return structured question/answer pairs. Settled on a JSON-response prompt with explicit formatting constraints to avoid parsing inconsistencies. Added topic depth control so users can request beginner, intermediate, or advanced cards.

process.title: UI & Study Mode
process.description: Designed a clean card flip interface with CSS 3D transforms. Built deck management views for creating, editing, and deleting decks. Added a progress tracker showing mastered vs. pending cards per session using local state with MongoDB persistence.

process.title: MVP Completion
process.description: Integrated the full generate → store → study flow. Connected the Express backend to MongoDB for deck and card persistence. Validated the end-to-end experience from topic input to completed study session, then iterated on card layout based on usability feedback.

projects.title: Personal Finance Tracker
projects.shortDescription: Budget, funds, and wallet management app for personal finance control
projects.fullDescription: A personal finance web application that gives users a complete picture of their financial health in one place. Users can define multiple wallets (cash, bank accounts, investment accounts), set monthly budgets per spending category, log transactions, and track fund allocations over time. Built around the principle of intentional budgeting — every dollar is assigned before it is spent — making it practical for users following zero-based or envelope-style budgeting approaches.

process.title: Requirements & Financial Logic
process.description: Mapped out the core financial entities: wallets, categories, budgets, transactions, and funds. Defined the calculation rules for available balance per wallet, budget utilization per category, and fund distribution. Researched common personal finance methodologies (zero-based budgeting, envelope system) to inform the data model.

process.title: Database Schema Design
process.description: Designed a relational schema in PostgreSQL to handle multi-wallet balances, recurring vs. one-time transactions, and fund snapshots over time. Focused on keeping aggregate queries efficient since the dashboard recalculates totals on every load.

process.title: Dashboard & Data Visualization
process.description: Built the main dashboard to surface wallet balances, budget progress bars per category, and a monthly spending breakdown chart using Chart.js. Designed the transaction log with filters by wallet, category, and date range for quick financial auditing.

process.title: MVP Delivery
process.description: Completed the core CRUD flows for wallets, categories, budgets, and transactions. Validated balance recalculation accuracy across transfer scenarios between wallets. Polished the UI for consistent number formatting, currency display, and mobile responsiveness before tagging the initial release.

projects.title: Vertikal Company — Web & Software Agency
projects.shortDescription: Full-service software development agency delivering custom web, e-commerce, and mobile solutions across Latin America
projects.fullDescription: Vertikal Company is a software development agency headquartered in San Salvador, El Salvador, with presence in Texas and the Netherlands. Specializing in custom software, web development, e-commerce platforms, and digital marketing, Vertikal serves clients ranging from local SMEs to international brands like Tigo Panama, Ria Latam International, and Analiza Laboratorios. During my time on the team, I contributed to frontend and web development projects across multiple client accounts, working within an agile workflow that covers discovery, UI design, development, QA, and deployment. Vertikal also operates Arka Software, their proprietary e-commerce platform built for the Central American market.

process.title: Client Discovery & Requirements
process.description: Each project started with a structured discovery phase: understanding the client's business model, defining functional requirements, identifying technical constraints, and setting delivery timelines. Projects ranged from landing pages and WooCommerce stores to custom web applications with third-party API integrations.

process.title: UI Design & Prototyping
process.description: Wireframes and high-fidelity mockups were produced in Figma before any code was written. Design decisions were validated with the client and the internal team, ensuring the final product aligned with both brand guidelines and usability standards before entering development.

process.title: Development & Integrations
process.description: Built and maintained web solutions primarily on WordPress and WooCommerce, with custom theme and plugin development. Worked on API integrations for payment gateways, CRMs, and third-party services. Collaborated in an agile environment with defined sprints, code reviews, and version control via Git.

process.title: QA, Delivery & Handoff
process.description: Projects went through a QA cycle covering cross-browser compatibility, mobile responsiveness, page performance, and functional testing before client delivery. Coordinated staging environments and client training sessions, ensuring smooth handoff and ongoing support coverage.
